a.title: Snack Ideas for School and at Home
a.span: Snack Ideas for School and at Home

p.span: The Forest City Regional School District will provide all district families with access to breakfast and lunch throughout the school closure. This Grab and Go program is available to ALL children in the district ages eighteen and younger. Each distribution will provide enough food for five days of breakfast and lunch for each child in the home.

span.br:
11:00 - 1:00 Union Dale Methodist Church
11:00 - 1:00 Pleasant Mount Social Center
11:00 - 1:00 Elementary School Circle

div.span:
If your family is in need of food but you are unable to participate in the food distribution as scheduled,
please call 570-785-2403 for assistance.

Also, remember that the purpose of the school closure is to minimize exposure to and to slow the spread of the Coronavirus. Individuals are encourages to social distance and to avoid groups of 10 or more people. PA Dept of Health recommends wearing a cloth/fabric mask when out in public. "My mask protects you, your mask protects me."

These are stressful times for all of us and there are a lot of unknowns. We will continue to share updates with you as we receive them. For now, we can only hope that Pennsylvania's rigorous response will have its intended effect of minimizing exposure to and slowing the spread of the Coronavirus. Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have any questions. We hope you and your family stay healthy and safe.

br.br: Please click below for the most recent update

br.span: Every Child, Every Need, Every Day

p.span:
1. Every child can learn.
2. Every child is entitled to an education that is designed to support their individual academic, social-emotional and behavioral needs.
3. Learning happens in a safe, supportive and collaborative environment.
4. We are a community of lifelong learners comprised of student, parents, teachers, paraprofessionals, administrators and community members.
5. High expectations for ALL are an integral part of the learning process.
6. The effort of our teachers and students makes all the difference and is the most valuable asset in our school district.
7. Collaboration among students, families, teachers, administrators and community members is essential for continuous improvement.
8. Our shared leadership approach will maximize the professional growth of our educational team by empowering individuals and giving them an opportunity to lead in their areas of expertise.
